cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with secret sharing schemes, which are commonly studied in the cryptography (cs.CR) and information theory (cs.IT) communities. The use of binary shares is a specific constraint that may be of interest to researchers in coding theory (cs.CC) and data structures (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the notion of semantic security, which is a concept often studied in the security and privacy (cs.SI) community.
